posts.cooked:
Hi community,

Recently I have observed the following phenomenon when I start Signal:

Device data:
Galaxy J7
Model Number: SM-J700M
OS: Android 6.0.1

Software: Signal 5.0.8

When I press “Report”, I am redirected to Google Privacy & Terms.
I would like to know following:

a) Why do I get this error message?
b) What kind of data is transferred to Google? I always declined!
c) Is this related to Android 6.0.1? Because with Android 10 there is no error message.
d) How do I get rid of the error message?

Any help would highly appreciated. Thank you for your time!
Does this happen every time you start Signal? If not, then when it happens, restart Signal app and go to Signal’s Settings | Advanced | Submit debug log and post the link here.

shellSignal:

Does this happen every time you start Signal?

No, it doesn’t. It occurs very irregularly.

I have now cleared the cache in Signal and will monitor the app in the near future. If contrary to expectations the warning message appears again, I will post a debug log here.

shellSignal:

If not, then when it happens, restart Signal app and go to Signal’s Settings | Advanced | Submit debug log and post the link here.

Whew! It just happened again. How can I post a debug log (link) in the forum?
Just wanted to send a debug log from the mobile. But then suddenly a message popped up that no debug log can be sent.

Sorry! Just see that I had a data interruption in the network…
Below now the desired debug link.
https://debuglogs.org/76bd688600b7b39344c3fbdc809e0b332e939e548a7c8f690b238549558bb533

Today the Smart Manager in the cell phone reports that “10 errors occurred in 1 week”. What is going on? I have never had problems with Signal before.

Signal - 10 errors in one week720×1280 38.1 KB

It’s been 5 years since you posted this, but I can’t find any other threads. Did you ever figure out what was happening? My mother is currently having the same problem. But, for her, it seems to be permanent. She hasn’t been able to use Signal in a couple of days. Unfortunately, she’s over a thousand miles away from me and is completely clueless about anything newer than a landline phone. So, I can’t provide any helpful information.
How current are/were the Signal versions? Also, how much storage is/was left on the phones?

Hi, I have the same problem. Due to my “main” phone being broken I am currently using an old phone with Android 6.0.1. Signal was working fine the last months but after the latest update to version 7.67.1 it doesn’t start anymore, it just says “Signal stopped working”. No “report” button, just “ok”.

I tried clearing the cache (Signal and Google Play Services), restarting the phone and freeing up some more storage (now >1GB free), also disabled battery optimization for Signal - nothing helped.

Anyone facing the same issue? Any ideas? Thanks!

Unfortunately, in my case, this is my mother’s phone which I know almost nothing about and which she’s entirely clueless to use. She’s using a Samsung Galaxy J7 Sky Pro phone. I think she got it way back in 2017. According to Tracfone, it’s running Android 6.0.1. But, according to Samsung, it looks like it could be running Android 7.0. I don’t know the version number for Signal on her phone, but I did manage to get her to the Google Play Store page for it and it doesn’t say “Update.” It just says Open. So, I’m assuming it’s up-to-date. I also assume it auto-updated back on 12/15/2025 since that’s when it stopped working.

Someone will be there next week who’s capable of pushing a few buttons on the phone. So, I’m planning on walking them through booting into Safe Mode and back, making sure the Google Play Store is set to auto-update all apps, making sure the OS is as up-to-date as it will get, clearing cache, and possibly uninstalling and re-installing Signal (which should be fun in itself since my mother’s apparently forgotten her PIN).

EDIT: On my phone, Signal updated (without problem) to v 7.68.4 on 12/15/2025. I’d have assumed the same for her. But, I see in @gem.ini ‘s post, above, that his update was to 7.67.1 when it failed. I also see in the App Info section on the Play Store that it’s supposed to work on Android 6.0 and up. So, it should be working.
Could you try checking to see if Signal still has Phone permission? That’s the only other thing I can come up with to check. But, my mother isn’t capable of doing that.

I’ve just checked it. 7.67 crashes but 7.68.4 works again. Try to update the app.

I think this commit fixed the bug:

github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android

Ensure that libraries use support for vectors.

committed 04:06PM - 15 Dec 25 UTC
greyson-signal
+1 -0

Fixes crashes on API 23 devices.

link_counts.title: Ensure that libraries use support for vectors. · signalapp/Signal-Android@0620410 · GitHub

posts.cooked: Thank you so much! I checked for updates earlier but wasn’t offered any, checked again now and was able to update to 7.68.4 which indeed works again! So relieved!

Hey, I didn’t mention but I removed all permissions and then activated them again, that also didn’t help. Also, I wiped the system cache which also made no difference. But there is a new version available now which solves the issue! (Thanks again to @DirkPitt1 ) So maybe your mother manages to go to the play store again and check for an “update” button? Good luck!
I’ve sent her a regular SMS with the link and instructions again. I’ll post back if she ever bothers to check and with the results. Thanks.
She managed to get the update and it works! Yay! Thanks.
